summary: Most frontend changes align with rebuilding the Replicate-based conversion flow, resolving the selected modelâ€™s direct URL from the backend, improving Replicate output handling, and implementing robust preview playback via Blob/ObjectURL with cleanup and user-facing playback errors. However, from the provided (truncated) backend diff, it is not clearly evidenced that the backend stores the converted audio as the completed job blob as required.

missing_requirements.requirement: The created job in the backend must store the converted audio bytes as the completed job blob (i.e., preview/download uses the converted audio).
missing_requirements.reason: The frontend now uploads the converted audio bytes to the backend, but the shown backend implementation of makeVoiceConversionJob sets the job status to #processing and stores the uploaded audio under inputVoiceAudio; the diff excerpt does not show the logic that sets status to #completed with blob = (converted audio). Because the backend code is truncated right where completion is implied, there is insufficient evidence that the completed job blob is actually set to the converted audio.
